chapters.display_text:
It is a grey day in Fukashima prefecture, Japan. Driving through the deserted villages of Okuma and Futaba, you see abandoned houses and other small buildings slowly being taken over by vegetation. Eventually you reach the site of the Fukashima II Nuclear Power Plant. There is a bustle of activity as the cleanup operation continues.
It’s possible to get from the car park to the main building without protective clothing, but you still swearing face masks.
In the briefing room.
a TEPCO engineer walks over to greet you.
He suggests an introduction in unit 5 to get your bearings before getting to work investigating the radiother reactors.
There is a corridor north that leads to the changing rooms and reactor unit 5.
There is a corridor south that leads to the robot control room.

actions.default: you don’t have time for that

chapters.display_text:
The changing rooms are very bright and sterile. A radiation shielding jumpsuit, gloves, breathing mask, goggles and hard hat lay on a bench near the entrance.
There is a door to the north leading to reactor unit 5.
There is a door to the south leading back to the briefing room.

actions.walk north: The engineer stops you and politely suggests you put on protective clothing.
actions.default: you don’t have time for that

chapters.display_text:
The engineer helps you put the jumpsuit and gloves on, taping up the gap between the sleeves and gloves. You put on the face mask which makes it harder to breath. The goggles and hard hat make things more uncomfortable.
You are ready to head north to reactor unit 5

actions.default: you don’t have time for that

chapters.display_text:
You head to a long corridor and make you way to reactor 5.
Entering the reactor building, there is a large red hatch which is used to access the primary containment vessel.
Movement is uncomfortable and hot as you carefully navigate through a confusing jumble of walkways,
pipes and machinery in the PCV.
You end up under the reactor core.
There is a walkway heading back to the changing rooms.

actions.default: you don’t have time for that
